intro: Adenocarpus grandiflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered burr bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes many nitrogen-fixing plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruit is a type of legume, known as a burr, which contains several seeds. Adenocarpus grandiflorus is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
